column4: when I click on .mp4 files I get a security warning asking me if I want to proceed? How can I get rid of this warning? It is messing up my ooimpress presentation.
you can just mount with captive-ntfs in Hoary.
I googled last time (and that was months ago, though), and found that you need to recompile
well, I've mounted an ntfs drive using captive...
the biggest pain about captive is that you need the windows NTFS driver...which you need to get from a Windows OS. I know XP SP1 works and XP SP2 doesn't.
captive will look for the driver on your drive, I believe.
if that's true, then, I'll set up captive on my own
you might have to help it find the driver.
but there are pretty good directions on the web. Can't remember where.
captive is supposed to be slower reading than the ntfs reader built-in. I've never confirmed this.
I don't know if you can automate mounting to captive-ntfs. I'm sure there's a way....
hmmm, should I google, or can you point me there?
and I can script automation, if it's simple enough
I can't remember exactly what I did. I just Googled myself out of curiousity and turned up this. http://www.kruyt.org/?sub_item=46
